contentrichtext.text: [[Image:1stLordGainford.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Jack Pease, 1st Baron Gainford]] '''Baron Gainford''', of Headlam in the County of Durham, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1917 for the [[Liberal Party (UK)|Liberal]] politician [[Jack Pease, 1st Baron Gainford|Jack Pease]], a member of the Darlington [[Pease family (Darlington)|Pease family]]. He notably served as [[President of the Board of Education]] from 1911 to 1915. Pease was the second son of [[Sir Joseph Pease, 1st Baronet|Sir Joseph W. Pease, 1st Baronet]], and the grandson of [[Joseph Pease (railway pioneer)|Joseph Pease]], while [[Arthur Pease (MP)|Arthur Pease]] was his uncle and [[Sir Arthur Pease, 1st Baronet|Sir Arthur Francis Pease, 1st Baronet]], [[John Pease, 1st Baron Wardington|Beaumont Pease, 1st Baron Wardington]], and [[Herbert Pike Pease, 1st Baron Daryngton]], were his first cousins. The third baron was a former member of the [[London County Council]] and of the [[Greater London Council]]. {{As of|2013}} the title is held by his younger brother, the fourth baron. As a descendant of Sir Joseph W. Pease, 1st Baronet, he is also in remainder to this title. ==Barons Gainford (1917)== *[[Jack Pease, 1st Baron Gainford|Joseph Albert "Jack" Pease, 1st Baron Gainford]] (1860–1943) *[[Joseph Pease, 2nd Baron Gainford]] (1889–1971) *[[Joseph Pease, 3rd Baron Gainford|Joseph Edward Pease, 3rd Baron Gainford]] (1921–2013)<ref> {{cite web | url = http://announcements.telegraph.co.uk/deaths/162342/gainford| title = Telegraph Announcements - 3rd Lord Gainford| accessdate = 17 July 2010}} </ref> *George Pease, 4th Baron Gainford (b. 1926) The [[heir apparent]] to the barony is the 4th Baron's eldest son, The Honourable Adrian Christopher Pease (born 1960). ==See also== *[[Pease Baronets|Pease Baronets of Hutton Lowcross]] *[[Pease Baronets|Pease Baronets of Hammersknott]] *[[Baron Daryngton]] *[[Pease family (Darlington)|Pease family]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{refbegin}} *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors).
